'''[[Elevated c-reactive protein (cr) SD-203|Inflammatory biomarkers]] (CRP, procalcitonin)'''''

- Non-specific, orientation value only

- Procalcitonin < 0.25 ng/ml makes bacteremia/fungemia unlikely

- No reason to measure them systematically

properties.question: Which of the following statements best describes the utility of measuring procalcitonin (PCT) levels in the context of bacteremia/fungemia?
properties.option_a: Procalcitonin levels above 0.5 ng/ml are always indicative of bacteremia/fungemia.
properties.option_c: Procalcitonin levels are irrelevant for diagnosing bacteremia/fungemia.
properties.option_d: Procalcitonin levels should be measured daily to monitor the progress of bacteremia/fungemia.
